intro: Sceletium gracile, commonly known as the "Kalahari apricot," is a small, flowering shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a distinctive, branched stem structure. Its leaves are typically small, fleshy, and covered in a fine layer of white wax. Sceletium gracile is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
